answerText: color force [or color charge][10] This fundamental force is carried by gluons and holds quarks together. It is described by quantum chromodynamics.

subject: Science
question: Question: Name this property of quarks that allows otherwise identical quarks to appear in a particle without violating the Pauli exclusion principle [10] Name this property of quarks that allows otherwise identical quarks to appear in a particle without violating the Pauli exclusion principle.
